verb.description: (with reference to the fingers or hand) close into a tight ball, especially when feeling extreme anger.
examples: she clenched her fists, struggling for control
John's right hand clenched into a fist

noun.description: A contraction or tightening of part of the body.
examples: she saw the anger rise, saw the clench of his fists

origin: Old English (in the sense of clinch fix securely): of Germanic origin; related to cling.
